api_base_path.description: Base Path at which the API is present - defaults to `/service/rest`. This only needs to be set if you run Sonatype Nexus Repository at a Base Path that is not `/`.

password.description: Password for your user for Sonatype Nexus Repository Server

username.description: Username for Sonatype Nexus Repository Server, requires role/permissions scoped to the resources you wish to manage

version_hint.description:
You can set this to the full version string (e.g. "3.85.0-03 (PRO)" or "3.80.0-06 (OSS)") of Sonatype Nexus Repository that you are connecting to.

> [!NOTE] 
> You can find the full version string in _Admin -> Support -> System Information_.
>				
> By default, this provider will attempt to automatically determine the version of Sonatype Nexus Repository you are connected to - but in some 
> real world cases, a Load Balancer or such may strip the HTTP Header that contians this information (the _Server_ header).

> [!TIP]
> If you receive an error such as `Plan is not supported for Sonatype Nexus Repository Manager: 0.0.0-0 (PRO=false)` then you should set 
> this attribute - otherwise, do not supply this attribute.

block.description:
Sonatype Nexus Repository must not be in read-only mode in order to use this Provider. This will be checked. 
		
Some resources and features depend on the version of Sonatype Nexus Repository you are running. See individual Data Source and Resource documentaiton for details.

id.description:
The id of the Role.

This should be unique and can be the name of an LDAP or SAML Group if you are using LDAP or SAML for authentication. 
Matching Roles based on id will automatically be granted to LDAP or SAML users.

privileges.description: The set of privileges assigned to this role.

roles.description: The set of roles assigned to this role.

mode.description: Determines what should be done with requests when their path matches any of the matchers. Valid values: ALLOW, BLOCK

active.description: Specify active security realms in usage order. At least one realm must be specified.

id.description: Resource identifier

last_name_attribute.description: IdP field mappings for user's family name

enabled.description: Whether or not User Tokens feature is enabled

protect_content.description: Additionally require user tokens for repository authentication

enabled.description: Whether or not Anonymous Access is enabled

realm_name.description: The name of the authentication realm for the anonymous account

user_id.description: The username of the anonymous account

auth_password.description: The password to bind with. Required if authScheme other than NONE.

auth_realm.description: The SASL realm to bind to. Required if authScheme is CRAM_MD5 or DIGEST_MD5.

auth_scheme.description: Authentication scheme used for connecting to LDAP server

auth_username.description: This must be a fully qualified username if simple authentication is used. Required if authScheme other than NONE.

connection_retry_delay.description: How many seconds to wait before retrying

connection_timeout.description: How many seconds to wait before timeout

group_base_dn.description: The relative DN where group objects are found (e.g. ou=Group). This value will have the Search base DN value appended to form the full Group search base DN. e.g. ou=Group

group_id_attribute.description: This field specifies the attribute of the Object class that defines the Group ID. Required if groupType is STATIC - e.g. cn

group_member_attribute.description: LDAP attribute containing the usernames for the group. Required if groupType is STATIC - e.g. memberUid

group_member_format.description: The format of user ID stored in the group member attribute. Required if groupType is STATIC - e.g. uid=${username},ou=people,dc=example,dc=com

group_object_class.description: LDAP class for group objects. Required if groupType is STATIC - e.g. posixGroup

group_subtree.description: Are groups located in structures below the group base DN?

group_type.description: Defines a type of groups used: static (a group contains a list of users) or dynamic (a user contains a list of groups). Required if ldapGroupsAsRoles is true.

id.description: Internal LDAP server ID

map_ldap_groups_to_roles.description: Denotes whether LDAP assigned roles are used as Nexus Repository Manager roles

max_connection_attempts.description: How many connection attempts before giving up

nexus_trust_store_enabled.description: Whether to use certificates stored in Nexus Repository Manager's truststore

order.description: Order number in which the server is being used when looking for a user - cannot be set during CREATE

search_base.description: LDAP location to be added to the connection URL

user_base_dn.description: The relative DN where user objects are found (e.g. ou=people). This value will have the Search base DN value appended to form the full User search base DN.

user_email_name_attribute.description: This is used to find an email address given the user ID - e.g. mail

user_id_attribute.description: This is used to find a user given its user ID - e.g. uid

user_ldap_filter.description: LDAP search filter to limit user search - e.g. (|(mail=*@example.com)(uid=dom*))

user_member_of_attribute.description: Set this to the attribute used to store the attribute which holds groups DN in the user object. Required if group_type is DYNAMIC

user_object_class.description: LDAP class for user objects - e.g. inetOrgPerson

user_password_attribute.description: If this field is blank the user will be authenticated against a bind with the LDAP server

user_real_name_attribute.description: This is used to find a real name given the user ID - e.g. cn

user_subtree.description: Are users located in structures below the user base DN?

enable_malware_cleanup.description:
When enabled, malware found will be scheduled to be cleaned up in the target proxy repositories.
			
**WARNING:** Enabling automatic malware clean up may remove dependencies currently in use by your applications, this may break any automated builds 
when Sonatype Repository Firewall quarantines these components the next time they are requested.

repository_name.description:
The the proxy repository to remove malware from.
			
**NOTE:** This proxy repository must already be configured with the Audit & Quarantine capability - i.e. have Sonatype Repostiory Firewall configured.

block.description:
Manage Task 'Automatic Malware Management' (malware.remediator)
	
This task requires the Sonatype Repository Firewall enabled with the `Security-Malicious` policy set to fail to function as expected.

Setting the connection to Sonatype IQ Server is a requirement forSonatype Repository Firewall to work and this task is using Firewall to generate the results.
